meanings.definition: Existing as an inherent or essential characteristic.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness was an inbeing part of her personality.
meanings.sent2: The inbeing nature of the tree's strength was evident in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The inbeing calmness of the cat surprised everyone when the dog barked loudly.
meanings.sent4: The inbeing beauty of the sunset painted the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The inbeing loyalty of the dog made it a beloved companion.

meanings.definition: Inborn or innate quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: His talent for music seemed to be an inbeing from a young age.
meanings.sent2: The inbeing of her intelligence was evident in her quick problem-solving skills.
meanings.sent3: The inbeing of his humor always lightened the mood in any situation.
meanings.sent4: The inbeing of her determination shone through as she worked towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The inbeing of his curiosity led him to explore new places and ideas.
